CatDescriptText: Mr. Joe Kenney, carpenter, 96 First Street, Ambridge, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "The way I see it, it doesn't make any difference what the person's race is. If a person is down hard enough, he is going to cheat the government in order to live.  I think that so far as race is concerned, as many of one race cheat as much as the other."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joe Kenney wearing light colored shirt and houndstooth jacket, seated on passenger side of car
